Schema.description: Affinity groups all the affinity rules related to a VM

dev.description: Device indicates the "logical" device name. The actual device name specified is not guaranteed to map to the device name in the guest OS. Treat it as a device ordering hint.

tray.description: Tray indicates if the tray of the device is open or closed. Allowed values are "open" and "closed" Defaults to closed

Schema.description: CPU allow specifying the CPU topology

cores.description: Cores specifies the number of cores inside the vm. Must be a value greater or equal 1.

Schema.description: Represents the clock and timers of a vm

timezone.description: Timezone sets the guest clock to the specified timezone. Zone name follows the TZ environment variable format (e.g. 'America/New_York')

utc.description: UTC sets the guest clock to UTC on each boot. If an offset is specified, guest changes to the clock will be kept during reboots and are not reset.

Schema.description: Exactly one of its members must be set.

timezone.description: Timezone sets the guest clock to the specified timezone. Zone name follows the TZ environment variable format (e.g. 'America/New_York')

utc.description: UTC sets the guest clock to UTC on each boot. If an offset is specified, guest changes to the clock will be kept during reboots and are not reset.

Schema.description: UTC sets the guest clock to UTC on each boot.

offsetSeconds.description: OffsetSeconds specifies an offset in seconds, relative to UTC. If set, guest changes to the clock will be kept during reboots and not reset.

Schema.description: Represents a cloud-init nocloud user data source More info: http://cloudinit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/topics/datasources/nocloud.html

secretRef.description: UserDataSecretRef references a k8s secret that contains NoCloud userdata

userDataBase64.description: UserDataBase64 contains NoCloud cloud-init userdata as a base64 encoded string

disks.description: Disks describes disks, cdroms, floppy and luns which are connected to the vm

watchdog.description: Watchdog describes a watchdog device which can be added to the vm

cdrom.description: Attach a volume as a cdrom to the vm

disk.description: Attach a volume as a disk to the vm

floppy.description: Attach a volume as a floppy to the vm

lun.description: Attach a volume as a LUN to the vm

volumeName.description: Name of the volume which is referenced Must match the Name of a Volume.

Schema.description: Represents the target of a volume to mount. Only one of its members may be specified.

cdrom.description: Attach a volume as a cdrom to the vm

disk.description: Attach a volume as a disk to the vm

floppy.description: Attach a volume as a floppy to the vm

lun.description: Attach a volume as a LUN to the vm

dev.description: Device indicates the "logical" device name. The actual device name specified is not guaranteed to map to the device name in the guest OS. Treat it as a device ordering hint.

clock.description: Clock sets the clock and timers of the vm.

cpu.description: CPU allow specified the detailed CPU topology inside the vm.

devices.description: Devices allows adding disks, network interfaces, ...

resources.description: Resources describes the Compute Resources required by this vm.

enabled.description: Enabled determines if the feature should be enabled or disabled on the guest Defaults to true

endOfInterrupt.description: EndOfInterrupt enables the end of interrupt notification in the guest Defaults to false

relaxed.description: Relaxed relaxes constraints on timer Defaults to the machine type setting

reset.description: Reset enables Hyperv reboot/reset for the vm Defaults to the machine type setting

runtime.description: Runtime Defaults to the machine type setting

spinlocks.description: Spinlocks indicates if spinlocks should be made available to the guest

synic.description: SyNIC enable Synthetic Interrupt Controller Defaults to the machine type setting

synictimer.description: SyNICTimer enable Synthetic Interrupt Controller timer Defaults to the machine type setting

vapic.description: VAPIC indicates weather virtual APIC is enabled Defaults to the machine type setting

vendorid.description: VendorID allows setting the hypervisor vendor id Defaults to the machine type setting

vpindex.description: VPIndex enables the Virtual Processor Index to help windows identifying virtual processors Defaults to the machine type setting

enabled.description: Enabled determines if the feature should be enabled or disabled on the guest Defaults to true

spinlocks.description: Retries indicates the number of retries Must be a value greater or equal 4096 Defaults to 4096

Schema.description: Represents if a feature is enabled or disabled

enabled.description: Enabled determines if the feature should be enabled or disabled on the guest Defaults to true
Enabled determines if the feature should be enabled or disabled on the guest Defaults to true

vendorid.description: VendorID sets the hypervisor vendor id, visible to the vm String up to twelve characters

acpi.description: ACPI enables/disables ACPI insidejsondata guest Defaults to enabled

apic.description: Defaults to the machine type setting

hyperv.description: Defaults to the machine type setting

uid.description: UID reported by the vm bios Defaults to a random generated uid

dev.description: Device indicates the "logical" device name. The actual device name specified is not guaranteed to map to the device name in the guest OS. Treat it as a device ordering hint.

tray.description: Tray indicates if the tray of the device is open or closed. Allowed values are "open" and "closed" Defaults to closed

present.description: Enabled set to false makes sure that the machine type or a preset can't add the timer. Defaults to true

tickPolicy.description: TickPolicy determines what happens when QEMU misses a deadline for injecting a tick to the guest One of "delay", "catchup", "merge", "discard"

present.description: Enabled set to false makes sure that the machine type or a preset can't add the timer. Defaults to true

action.description: The action to take. Valid values are poweroff, reset, shutdown. Defaults to reset

present.description: Enabled set to false makes sure that the machine type or a preset can't add the timer. Defaults to true

dev.description: Device indicates the "logical" device name. The actual device name specified is not guaranteed to map to the device name in the guest OS. Treat it as a device ordering hint.

type.description: QEMU machine type is the actual chipset of the VM.

present.description: Enabled set to false makes sure that the machine type or a preset can't add the timer. Defaults to true

tickPolicy.description: TickPolicy determines what happens when QEMU misses a deadline for injecting a tick to the guest One of "delay", "catchup", "discard"

present.description: Enabled set to false makes sure that the machine type or a preset can't add the timer. Defaults to true

tickPolicy.description: TickPolicy determines what happens when QEMU misses a deadline for injecting a tick to the guest One of "delay", "catchup"

track.description: Track the guest or the wall clock

Schema.description: Represents a docker image with an embedded disk

image.description: Image is the name of the image with the embedded disk

requests.description: Requests is a description of the initial vm resources. Valid resource keys are "memory" and "cpu".

Schema.description: Represents all available timers in a vm

hpet.description: HPET (High Precision Event Timer) - multiple timers with periodic interrupts.

hyperv.description: Hyperv (Hypervclock) - lets guests read the host’s wall clock time (paravirtualized). For windows guests.

kvm.description: KVM 	(KVM clock) - lets guests read the host’s wall clock time (paravirtualized). For linux guests.

pit.description: PIT (Programmable Interval Timer) - a timer with periodic interrupts.

rtc.description: RTC (Real Time Clock) - a continuously running timer with periodic interrupts.

Schema.description: VirtualMachine is *the* VM Definition. It represents a virtual machine in the runtime environment of kubernetes.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: VM Spec contains the VM specification.

status.description: Status is the high level overview of how the VM is doing. It contains information available to controllers and users.

Schema.description: VirtualMachineSpec is a description of a VirtualMachine.

affinity.description: If affinity is specifies, obey all the affinity rules

domain.description: Specification of the desired behavior of the VirtualMachine on the host.

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is a selector which must be true for the vm to fit on a node. Selector which must match a node's labels for the vm to be scheduled on that node. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/assign-pod-node/

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.description: Grace period observed after signalling a VM to stop after which the VM is force terminated.

volumes.description: List of volumes that can be mounted by disks belonging to the vm.

Schema.description: VirtualMachineStatus represents information about the status of a VM. Status may trail the actual state of a system.

conditions.description: Conditions are specific points in VM's pod runtime.

migrationNodeName.description: MigrationNodeName is the node where the VM is live migrating to.

nodeName.description: NodeName is the name where the VM is currently running.

phase.description: Phase is the status of the VM in kubernetes world. It is not the VM status, but partially correlates to it.

Schema.description: Volume represents a named volume in a vm.

cloudInitNoCloud.description: CloudInitNoCloud represents a cloud-init NoCloud user-data source. The NoCloud data will be added as a disk to the vm. A proper cloud-init installation is required inside the guest. More info: http://cloudinit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/topics/datasources/nocloud.html

iscsi.description: ISCSI represents an ISCSI Disk resource which is directly attached to the vm via qemu.

name.description: Volume's name. Must be a DNS_LABEL and unique within the vm. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

persistentVolumeClaim.description: PersistentVolumeClaimVolumeSource represents a reference to a PersistentVolumeClaim in the same namespace. Directly attached to the vm via qemu. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#persistentvolumeclaims

registryDisk.description: RegistryDisk references a docker image, embedding a qcow or raw disk More info: https://kubevirt.gitbooks.io/user-guide/registry-disk.html

Schema.description: Represents the source of a volume to mount. Only one of its members may be specified.

cloudInitNoCloud.description: CloudInitNoCloud represents a cloud-init NoCloud user-data source. The NoCloud data will be added as a disk to the vm. A proper cloud-init installation is required inside the guest. More info: http://cloudinit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/topics/datasources/nocloud.html

iscsi.description: ISCSI represents an ISCSI Disk resource which is directly attached to the vm via qemu.

persistentVolumeClaim.description: PersistentVolumeClaimVolumeSource represents a reference to a PersistentVolumeClaim in the same namespace. Directly attached to the vm via qemu. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#persistentvolumeclaims

registryDisk.description: RegistryDisk references a docker image, embedding a qcow or raw disk More info: https://kubevirt.gitbooks.io/user-guide/registry-disk.html

Schema.description: Hardware watchdog device Exactly one of its members must be set.
